Subprogram Descriptions

ASSOCIATED_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Associated_ScatterCoeff

 PURPOSE:
       Function to test the association status of the pointer members of a
       ScatterCoeff structure.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Association_Status = Associated_ScatterCoeff( ScatterCoeff,       &  ! Input
                                                     ANY_Test = Any_Test )  ! Optional input

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff:        ScatterCoeff structure which is to have its pointer
                            member's association status tested.
                            UNITS:      N/A
                            TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                            DIMENSION:  Scalar
                            ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ANY_Test:            Set this argument to test if ANY of the
                            ScatterCoeff structure pointer members are associated.
                            The default is to test if ALL the pointer members
                            are associated.
                            If ANY_Test = 0, test if ALL the pointer members
                                             are associated.  (DEFAULT)
                               ANY_Test = 1, test if ANY of the pointer members
                                             are associated.
                            UNITS:      N/A
                            TYPE:       INTEGER
                            DIMENSION:  Scalar
                            ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Association_Status:  The return value is a logical value indicating the
                            association status of the ScatterCoeff pointer members.
                            .TRUE.  - if ALL the ScatterCoeff pointer members are
                                      associated, or if the ANY_Test argument
                                      is set and ANY of the ScatterCoeff pointer
                                      members are associated.
                            .FALSE. - some or all of the ScatterCoeff pointer
                                      members are NOT associated.
                            UNITS:      N/A
                            TYPE:       LOGICAL
                            DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       None.

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

DESTROY_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Previous Subprogram] [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Destroy_ScatterCoeff
 
 PURPOSE:
       Function to re-initialize the scalar and pointer members of ScatterCoeff
       data structures.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Error_Status = Destroy_ScatterCoeff( ScatterCoeff,             &  ! Output
                                            RCS_Id = RCS_Id,          &  ! Revision control
                                            Message_Log = Message_Log )  ! Error messaging

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       Message_Log:  Character string specifying a filename in which any
                     messages will be logged. If not specified, or if an
                     error occurs opening the log file, the default action
                     is to output messages to standard output.
                     UNITS:      None
                     TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                     DIMENSION:  Scalar
                     ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff: Re-initialized ScatterCoeff structure.
                     UNITS:      N/A
                     TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                     DIMENSION:  Scalar
                     ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN OUT )

 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:       Character string containing the Revision Control
                     System Id field for the module.
                     UNITS:      None
                     TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                     DIMENSION:  Scalar
                     ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Error_Status: The return value is an integer defining the error status.
                     The error codes are defined in the ERROR_HANDLER module.
                     If == SUCCESS the structure re-initialisation was successful
                        == FAILURE - an error occurred, or
                                   - the structure internal allocation counter
                                     is not equal to zero (0) upon exiting this
                                     function. This value is incremented and
                                     decremented for every structure allocation
                                     and deallocation respectively.
                     UNITS:      N/A
                     TYPE:       INTEGER
                     DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       Display_Message:    Subroutine to output messages
                           SOURCE: ERROR_HANDLER module

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 COMMENTS:
       Note the INTENT on the output ScatterCoeff argument is IN OUT rather than
       just OUT. This is necessary because the argument may be defined upon
       input. To prevent memory leaks, the IN OUT INTENT is a must.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

ALLOCATE_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Previous Subprogram] [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Allocate_ScatterCoeff
 
 PURPOSE:
       Function to allocate the pointer members of the ScatterCoeff
       data structure.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Error_Status = Allocate_ScatterCoeff( n_DummyDimension,         &  ! Input
                                             ScatterCoeff,             &  ! Output
                                             RCS_Id = RCS_Id,          &  ! Revision control
                                             Message_Log = Message_Log )  ! Error messaging

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       n_DummyDimension:   Required dimension of ScatterCoeff structure pointer
                           members.
                           Must be > 0.
                           UNITS:      N/A
                           TYPE:       INTEGER
                           DIMENSION:  Scalar
                           ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       Message_Log:        Character string specifying a filename in which any
                           messages will be logged. If not specified, or if an
                           error occurs opening the log file, the default action
                           is to output messages to standard output.
                           UNITS:      None
                           TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                           DIMENSION:  Scalar
                           ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff:       ScatterCoeff structure with allocated pointer members
                           UNITS:      N/A
                           TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                           DIMENSION:  Scalar
                           ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN OUT )


 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:             Character string containing the Revision Control
                           System Id field for the module.
                           UNITS:      None
                           TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                           DIMENSION:  Scalar
                           ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Error_Status:       The return value is an integer defining the error status.
                           The error codes are defined in the ERROR_HANDLER module.
                           If == SUCCESS the structure pointer allocations were
                                         successful
                              == FAILURE - an error occurred, or
                                         - the structure internal allocation counter
                                           is not equal to one (1) upon exiting this
                                           function. This value is incremented and
                                           decremented for every structure allocation
                                           and deallocation respectively.
                           UNITS:      N/A
                           TYPE:       INTEGER
                           DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       Associated_ScatterCoeff:  Function to test the association status of the
                                 pointer members of a ScatterCoeff structure.

       Destroy_ScatterCoeff:     Function to re-initialize the scalar and pointer
                                 members of ScatterCoeff data structures.

       Display_Message:          Subroutine to output messages
                                 SOURCE: ERROR_HANDLER module

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 COMMENTS:
       Note the INTENT on the output ScatterCoeff argument is IN OUT rather than
       just OUT. This is necessary because the argument may be defined upon
       input. To prevent memory leaks, the IN OUT INTENT is a must.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

ASSIGN_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Previous Subprogram] [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Assign_ScatterCoeff

 PURPOSE:
       Function to copy valid ScatterCoeff structures.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Error_Status = Assign_ScatterCoeff( ScatterCoeff_in,          &  ! Input
                                           ScatterCoeff_out,         &  ! Output
                                           RCS_Id = RCS_Id,          &  ! Revision control
                                           Message_Log = Message_Log )  ! Error messaging

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff_in:   ScatterCoeff structure which is to be copied.
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       Message_Log:       Character string specifying a filename in which any
                          messages will be logged. If not specified, or if an
                          error occurs opening the log file, the default action
                          is to output messages to standard output.
                          UNITS:      None
                          TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff_out:  Copy of the input structure, ScatterCoeff_in.
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN OUT )


 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:            Character string containing the Revision Control
                          System Id field for the module.
                          UNITS:      None
                          TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Error_Status:      The return value is an integer defining the error status.
                          The error codes are defined in the ERROR_HANDLER module.
                          If == SUCCESS the structure assignment was successful
                             == FAILURE an error occurred
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       INTEGER
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       Associated_ScatterCoeff:  Function to test the association status of the
                                 pointer members of a ScatterCoeff structure.

       Allocate_ScatterCoeff:    Function to allocate the pointer members of
                                 the ScatterCoeff data structure.

       Display_Message:          Subroutine to output messages
                                 SOURCE: ERROR_HANDLER module

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       The ScatterCoeff structure copy is performed only if *all* of the
       pointer members of the input structure are associated. If this is
       not the case, then the input structure is treated as "empty" and
       the output structure is thus simply destroyed upon exit to reflect
       this "empty" status.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 COMMENTS:
       Note the INTENT on the output ScatterCoeff argument is IN OUT rather than
       just OUT. This is necessary because the argument may be defined upon
       input. To prevent memory leaks, the IN OUT INTENT is a must.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

EQUAL_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Previous Subprogram] [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Equal_ScatterCoeff

 PURPOSE:
       Function to test if two ScatterCoeff structures are equal.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Error_Status = Equal_ScatterCoeff( ScatterCoeff_LHS,         &  ! Input
                                          ScatterCoeff_RHS,         &  ! Input
                                          ULP_Scale   = ULP_Scale,  &  ! Optional input
                                          Check_All = Check_All,    &  ! Optional input
                                          RCS_Id = RCS_Id,          &  ! Revision control
                                          Message_Log = Message_Log )  ! Error messaging

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff_LHS:  ScatterCoeff structure to be compared; equivalent to the
                          left-hand side of a lexical comparison, e.g.
                            IF ( ScatterCoeff_LHS == ScatterCoeff_RHS ).
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

       ScatterCoeff_RHS:  ScatterCoeff structure to be compared to; equivalent to
                          right-hand side of a lexical comparison, e.g.
                            IF ( ScatterCoeff_LHS == ScatterCoeff_RHS ).
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ULP_Scale:         Unit of data precision used to scale the floating
                          point comparison. ULP stands for "Unit in the Last Place,"
                          the smallest possible increment or decrement that can be
                          made using a machine's floating point arithmetic.
                          Value must be positive - if a negative value is supplied,
                          the absolute value is used. If not specified, the default
                          value is 1.
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       INTEGER
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

       Check_All:         Set this argument to check ALL the floating point
                          channel data of the ScatterCoeff structures. The default
                          action is return with a FAILURE status as soon as
                          any difference is found. This optional argument can
                          be used to get a listing of ALL the differences
                          between data in ScatterCoeff structures.
                          If == 0, Return with FAILURE status as soon as
                                   ANY difference is found  *DEFAULT*
                             == 1, Set FAILURE status if ANY difference is
                                   found, but continue to check ALL data.
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       INTEGER
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

       Message_Log:       Character string specifying a filename in which any
                          messages will be logged. If not specified, or if an
                          error occurs opening the log file, the default action
                          is to output messages to standard output.
                          UNITS:      None
                          TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:            Character string containing the Revision Control
                          System Id field for the module.
                          UNITS:      None
                          TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar
                          ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Error_Status:      The return value is an integer defining the error status.
                          The error codes are defined in the ERROR_HANDLER module.
                          If == SUCCESS the structures were equal
                             == FAILURE - an error occurred, or
                                        - the structures were different.
                          UNITS:      N/A
                          TYPE:       INTEGER
                          DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       Associated_ScatterCoeff:  Function to test the association status of the
                                 pointer members of a ScatterCoeff structure.

       Compare_Float:            Function to compare floating point numbers
                                 for equality.
                                 SOURCE: COMPARE_FLOAT_NUMBERS module.

       Display_Message:          Subroutine to output messages
                                 SOURCE: ERROR_HANDLER module

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

CHECK_SCATTERCOEFF_RELEASE

 [Previous Subprogram] [Next Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Check_ScatterCoeff_Release

 PURPOSE:
       Function to check the ScatterCoeff Release value.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       Error_Status = Check_ScatterCoeff_Release( ScatterCoeff,             &  ! Input
                                                  RCS_Id      = RCS_Id,     &  ! Revision control
                                                  Message_Log = Message_Log )  ! Error messaging

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff:  ScatterCoeff structure for which the Release member
                      is to be checked.
                      UNITS:      N/A
                      TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       Message_Log:   Character string specifying a filename in which any
                      messages will be logged. If not specified, or if an
                      error occurs opening the log file, the default action
                      is to output messages to standard output.
                      UNITS:      None
                      TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN ), OPTIONAL

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:        Character string containing the Revision Control
                      System Id field for the module.
                      UNITS:      None
                      TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 FUNCTION RESULT:
       Error_Status:  The return value is an integer defining the error status.
                      The error codes are defined in the ERROR_HANDLER module.
                      If == SUCCESS the structure Release value is valid.
                         == FAILURE the structure Release value is NOT valid
                                    and either a data file file or software
                                    update is required.
                      UNITS:      N/A
                      TYPE:       INTEGER
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar

 CALLS:
       Display_Message:      Subroutine to output messages
                             SOURCE: ERROR_HANDLER module

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)

VERSION_SCATTERCOEFF

 [Previous Subprogram] [List of Subprograms] 
 NAME:
       Version_ScatterCoeff

 PURPOSE:
       Subroutine to return a string containing version and dimension
       information about the ScatterCoeff data structure.

 CATEGORY:
       Scattering : ScatterCoeff

 LANGUAGE:
       Fortran-95

 CALLING SEQUENCE:
       CALL Version_ScatterCoeff( ScatterCoeff,       &  ! Input
                                  Version_Info,   &  ! Output
                                  RCS_Id = RCS_Id )  ! Revision control

 INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       ScatterCoeff:  Filled ScatterCoeff structure.
                      UNITS:      N/A
                      TYPE:       ScatterCoeff_type
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( IN )

 OPTIONAL INPUT ARGUMENTS:
       None.

 OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       Version_Info:  String containing version and dimension information
                      about the passed ScatterCoeff data structure.
                      UNITS:      N/A
                      TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT )

 OPTIONAL OUTPUT ARGUMENTS:
       RCS_Id:        Character string containing the Revision Control
                      System Id field for the module.
                      UNITS:      None
                      TYPE:       CHARACTER(*)
                      DIMENSION:  Scalar
                      ATTRIBUTES: INTENT( OUT ), OPTIONAL

 CALLS:
       None.

 SIDE EFFECTS:
       None.

 RESTRICTIONS:
       None.

 CREATION HISTORY:
       Written by:     Paul van Delst, CIMSS/SSEC 24-Jun-2004
                       paul.vandelst@ssec.wisc.edu

(See ScatterCoeff_Define.f90)
